# Import Content and Islands

> **来源**: https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/import-content-and-islands-in-unreal-editor-for-fortnite
> **爬取时间**: 2025-12-26T22:55:51.103106

---

In **Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN)** you can import [assets](unreal-editor-for-fortnite-glossary#asset) you created in third-party tools like Maya 3D, Blender, Sketchfab, Quixel, and Unreal Engine, or any other asset that meets the UEFN criteria.

Any imported assets must follow the content guidelines and [specifications](https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/creating-fortniteready-assets-in-unreal-editor-for-fortnite).

In this section you can learn more about:

- Importing third party custom assets,
- Configuring [collision](unreal-editor-for-fortnite-glossary#collision) on static meshes,
- Importing assets from the Content Library,
- Converting Fornite Islands to UEFN,
- Migrating Assets from Unreal Editor.

Once you finish importing and configuring your assets, they are added to your project and can be [playtested](playtesting-your-island-unreal-editor-for-fortnite) in Fortnite Creative!

[![Project and Asset Security](https://dev.epicgames.com/community/api/documentation/image/1f33352b-5637-40eb-8058-82e7439ebcfd?resizing_type=fit&width=640&height=640)
